TopicTitle: RizzoTECH Interplanetary Rocket Designs INC. (Now accepting orders!!)

Articles.Content:
Welcome to RizzoTECH INC.!

Parts now included!

Here at RizzoTECH, our goal is to make safe, efficient and reliable interplanetary carrier rockets*

So far, our engineers have designed two standard interplanetary lifting vehicles. The first, code named Standard Interplanetary Lifting Rocket, or SILR, is the pinnacle of Kerbal engineering. Weighing only 54 tonnes without payload, this rocket can get to any planet in the Kerbol system and still have fuel for maneuvering(Specs below)! The second rocket our engineers have constructed came with the death of several (hundred) Kerbals, but is perfect for getting larger payloads to Duna or its moon.This rocket has been code named Standard Interplanetary Heavy Lifting Rocket, or SIHLR for short.

Required Parts

RizzoTECH has decided to reupload the parts that are needed for most of our "safe" rockets! (Note:RizzoTECH owns none of these parts. This is only a reupload. All credit goes to Industrial Flames and Explosions)

Download: http://www./?pqpj6mc7rtxitwe

Lifter Specs.

SILR

Max Payload: 6 tonnes

Lifter Weight: Approximately 54 tonnes

Loaded Weight: Between 55 and 60 tonnes

Range: Moho-Jool (Any moons in between)

Desc: Highly customizable long range interplanetary lifting rocket.

Pictures:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34223[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]34224[/ATTACH]

.CRAFT File: http://www./?hpwuo58nqooywgw

SIHLR

Max Payload: 12 tonnes

Lifter Weight: Approximately 75 tonnes

Loaded Weight: Between 76 and 88 tonnes

Range: Duna (And its moon)

Desc: Large payload, long range Duna lifter.

Pictures:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34225[/ATTACH]

.CRAFT File: http://www./?aak2wi4eck1eyvx

Thank you for shopping at RizzoTECH!

DUNA KETHSAT

RizzoTECH proudly presents our first Kethane miner! Although it is a stationary miner, and can only land on Duna or Ike, this miner can land on Duna to mine Kethane, plus it can also serve as an orbital refueling depot! (Note: although or engineers have tried, but to no avail, to add safety features such as solar powered engines in case of an emergency, RizzoTECH has not given up and hope will have a new and improvement miner very soon.

Specs:

Weight: Aproximently 8 tonnes

Launch Vehicle: Modified SILR

Range: Duna/Ike

Special Instructions: About halfway through SRB burn, ignite the liquid fueled engine. RCS is mandatory if using MecgJeb.

Desc: A large capacity, heavy Kethane miner for Duna or its moon Ike, this miner is ideal for mining a large amount of Kethane and keeping it in storage. (Note: see warranty disclaimer for information about MechJeb usage)

Pictures:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34309[/ATTACH] (No pics from Duna yet because of my laggy computer )

.CRAFT File: http://www./?fsl4na9j2ie9jpd

Jool Munar ReconSAT

RizzoTech proudly presents our first ISA Mapping satellite. As you may have understood from the name, this satellite is a munar recon satellite. It's primary purpose is to map any moon of Jool you wish to map. So far, this is a very basic design with nothing really special besides the ISA mapper. But, RizzoTECH engineers are hard at work trying to build better, more effective mapping satellites.

Specs:

Weight: Aproximently 2.2 tonnes

Launch Vehicle: SILR (With fairings)

Range: Jool/Layhte/Vall/Tylo/Bop

Special Instructions: Launch into a polar synchronous orbit for most effective mapping. (100 km altitude is best)

Desc: A small, and efficient mapping satellite capable of reaching any of Jool's moons with fuel to spare.

Pictures:

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34316[/ATTACH] (More Images at link: http://imgur.com/a/o9Lyk#0)

.CRAFT File: http://www./?gs8d2osgdr5g46c

Low Atmospheric Probe

RizzoTECH proudly presents it's newest innovation in rocket technology. The Low Atmospheric Probe! All though this probe can go much farther than the lower atmosphere, we gave it that name because thats when the parachute opens. This satellite uses a new Kerbin orbit launch system called Disposable kerbin Launch System, or DKLS for short. (Pictures and downloads for both crafts below!)

Weight: 3.2 tonnes

Launch Vehicle: DKLS

Range: Kerbin

Special Instructions: None!

Desc: A multi use probe for mapping communications, or whatever else you may have in mind.

Pictures: (http://imgur.com/a/EntZo#0)

.CRAFT Files:

Launch Vehicle: http://www./?dicsasjskzo74ao

Probe+Launch Vehicle: http://www./?zcw4hlusa9gh4wm

Geostationary Orbit Comm SAT

RizzoTECH proudly presents it's newest innovation in communications technology! This extremely lightweight, but reliable, satellite is perfect for setting up communications grids. Its light, its safe, but most importantly, its the cheapest communications satellite you will find on the market place! (Note: Ion engines and battery acquired from the Kerbal States of Kerbalia)

Weight: 2.1 tonnes

Launch Vehicle: DKLS

Range: Kerbin/Mun/Minmus

Special Instructions: None!

Desc: A medium range lightweight and cost effective communications satellite designed for operation within the Kerbin System

Pictures: http://imgur.com/a/lq54Z#0

.CRAFT File: http://www./?ntz9f7j6sdpg6e7

Mods used:

NovaPunch (http://www.kerbal.net/mod.php?id=31),

Kosmos (http://www./?ywv447udgu4vs25),

White Monkey's mods (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/4118-White-Monkey-Kitchenware-and-SpaceParts-Factory-ver-0-4-HOPE-SHUTTLE), cBBp's Falcain mod (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/4275-cBBp-SPC-Pack-v0-4-Fixed-Failcan-RCS-and-added-some-adapter-pieces-Enjoy),

Probodyne Kit (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12237-Silisko-Industries-Addon-Development-Thread-2),

IFE (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/3396-Industrial-Flames-Explosions-Inc-Version-1-4-2-Now-Available%21),

Expi Interplanetary Probe Pack (http://kerbal.net/mod.php?id=7),

MechJeb (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12384-PLUGIN-PART-0-17-Anatid-Robotics-MuMech-MechJeb-Autopilot-v1-9-3),

KW Rocketry/Challenger Pack (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/2448-0-16-KW-Rocketry-v0-5),

Kethane Pack/Satellite Pack (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/13692-Mechanical-Mouse-Industries-Kethane-Payload-Packs-Released%21%21%21),

ISA(http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/9396-0-17-ISA-MapSat-Satellite-mapping-module-and-map-generation-tool-v3-3-0),

Down Undfer Aerospace (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/3097-Down-Under-Aerospace-Party-Supplies-v0-4-AUSPLANE!)

Silisko Edition: (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12237-Silisko-Industries-Addon-Development-Thread-2)

Probodobodyne Industrials: (http://www.kerbal.net/mod.php?id=62)

(Please feel free to correct me if I missed any or got some names wrong. And, we are now taking orders! Just comment what you want, and I'll (try to) build it! )

*Results not gaurenteed. RizzoTECH is not responsible for any damages or losses. As soon as any kind of damage is put onto the ship, warranty will be voided. If MechJeb is used, warranty will also be voided.

-RizzoTECH INC.

Edited October 18, 2012 by Pual24

Yup! But these are Kerbals, who a needs warranty?

Edited October 5, 2012 by Pual24

What about an !eyecandy! rocket with the kethane mod on board??

I think it should be at least able to get to duna mine some kethane there and maybe, if one decides it should, serve as an orbital refilling station at duna or any other moon/planet.

In case any failure will occur during the mission it maybe also should have a working solar panel config (electrical plugin, powertech dynasat etc) with some batteries and enough thrust to be able to land, just in case fuel runs out or sth explodes
